author: mcjaco
title: Big and small of it, this set had it all.
review:
As with my other reviews, my soon to be 4 year olds discovered my tubs of childhood Legos, and now we're recreating all my sets.  I'm slowly working my way through those sets and reviewing them....while also holding off buying new ones!

Box/Instructions

If I recall correctly, I found this on a peg at either the local V&S Variety shop, or Toys R Us one summer afternoon.  My Mom quickly relented, as she usually did for Legos, and I had this pack in my hands.  Two small sets (like the picture), packed onto a flat.

Parts

Nothing overly shocking via the parts for this.  The two hook, the cool flat windscreen for the tow truck, and a ton of clear lights.

As for the race car/go cart, it was a simple build off a odd chasis that gave the car it's leaning forward look.

Minifigures

Each vehicle came with their own minifig.  Both rather generic.  Typical overalls and ball cap for the tow truck driver, and a simple red zippered racing outfit with simple white helmut.  

The build

The tow truck is a fun build, as the color scheme is quite cool.  The striping sets this tow truck apart, and it's utilitarian looks with the large white grill, flat windscreen, and multiple headlights, and warning lights are very cool. I love the additional fog lights added below the chasis, and the tail lights as well.  

With the go cart, there's not much too it.  Although the printed piece with the speedy "V" is a nice addition, to an otherwise pretty plain build.  

The completed model

As stated earlier, the tow truck is the prize in this carded set.  The red, white and blue striping on the body is what caught my eye 20 years ago.  It still does today.  There's naturally good playability with the tow hook, and this was a natural addition to my Exxon Gas Station, due to the color scheme.

The go cart does it's job.  It's a fun little racer that was added to our Motor Speedway, group of cars.

Overall opinion

The tow truck is the winner in this set.  It still is visually fun, and is busy hauling cars back and forth 20 years later in our Town.  

The go cart is a simple, yet fun, little car that exudes speed.
